verses.verse: And he heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of Laban <S%H3837><s%>'s sons <S%H1121><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Jacob <S%H3290><s%> hath taken away <S%H3947><s%> all that was our father <S%H1><s%>'s; and of that which was our father <S%H1><s%>'s hath he gotten <S%H6213><s%> all this glory <S%H3519><s%>.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> beheld <S%H7200><s%> the countenance <S%H6440><s%> of Laban <S%H3837><s%>, and <S%H8543><s%>, behold, it was not toward him as beforetime <S%H8032><s%>.

And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, Return <S%H7725><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of thy fathers <S%H1><s%>, and to thy kindred <S%H4138><s%>; and I will be with thee.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> Rachel <S%H7354><s%> and Leah <S%H3812><s%> to the field <S%H7704><s%> unto his flock <S%H6629><s%>,

and said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H7200><s%>, I see your father <S%H1><s%>'s countenance <S%H6440><s%>, that it is not toward me as <S%H8543><s%> beforetime <S%H8032><s%>; but the God <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%> hath been with me <S%H1961><s%>.
And ye <S%H859><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> that with all my power <S%H3581><s%> I have served <S%H5647><s%> your father <S%H1><s%>.

And your father <S%H1><s%> hath deceived <S%H2048><s%> me <S%H2498><s%>, and changed my wages <S%H4909><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> times <S%H4489><s%>; but God <S%H430><s%> suffered him <S%H5414><s%> not to hurt <S%H7489><s%> me <S%H5978><s%>.

If he said <S%H559><s%> thus <S%H5348><s%>, The speckled shall be thy wages <S%H7939><s%>; then all the flock <S%H6629><s%> bare <S%H3205><s%> speckled <S%H5348><s%>: and if he said <S%H559><s%> thus <S%H6124><s%>, The ringstreaked shall be thy wages <S%H7939><s%>; then bare <S%H3205><s%> all the flock <S%H6629><s%> ringstreaked <S%H6124><s%>.
Thus God <S%H430><s%> hath taken away <S%H5337><s%> the cattle <S%H4735><s%> of your father <S%H1><s%>, and given them to me <S%H5414><s%>.

And it came to pass at the time <S%H6256><s%> that the flock <S%H6629><s%> conceive <S%H3179><s%>, that I lifted up <S%H5375><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> in a dream <S%H2472><s%>, and <S%H6260><s%>, behold, the he-goats which leaped <S%H5927><s%> upon the flock <S%H6629><s%> were ringstreaked <S%H6124><s%>, speckled <S%H5348><s%>, and grizzled <S%H1261><s%>.
And the angel <S%H4397><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me in the dream <S%H2472><s%>, Jacob <S%H3290><s%>: and I said <S%H559><s%>, Here am I.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Lift up <S%H5375><s%> now thine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and see <S%H7200><s%>: all the he-goats <S%H6260><s%> which leap <S%H5927><s%> upon the flock <S%H6629><s%> are ringstreaked <S%H6124><s%>, speckled <S%H5348><s%>, and grizzled <S%H1261><s%>: for I have seen <S%H7200><s%> all that Laban <S%H3837><s%> doeth unto thee <S%H6213><s%>.

I am the God <S%H410><s%> of Beth-el <S%H1008><s%>, where thou anointedst <S%H4886><s%> a pillar <S%H4676><s%>, where thou vowedst <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> unto me <S%H6965><s%>: now arise, get thee out <S%H3318><s%> from this land <S%H776><s%>, and return <S%H7725><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of thy nativity <S%H4138><s%>.

And Rachel <S%H7354><s%> and Leah <S%H3812><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H2506><s%>, Is there yet any portion or inheritance <S%H5159><s%> for us in our father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>?
Are we not accounted <S%H2803><s%> by him as foreigners <S%H5237><s%>? for he hath sold <S%H4376><s%> us <S%H398><s%>, and hath also quite devoured <S%H398><s%> our money <S%H3701><s%>.

For all the riches <S%H6239><s%> which God <S%H430><s%> hath taken <S%H5337><s%> away from our father <S%H1><s%>, that is ours and our children <S%H1121><s%>'s: now then <S%H430><s%>, whatsoever God hath said <S%H559><s%> unto thee <S%H6213><s%>, do.
Then Jacob <S%H3290><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and set <S%H5375><s%> his sons <S%H1121><s%> and his wives <S%H802><s%> upon the camels <S%H1581><s%>;

and he carried away <S%H5090><s%> all his cattle <S%H4735><s%>, and all his substance <S%H7399><s%> which he had gathered <S%H7408><s%>, the cattle <S%H4735><s%> of his getting <S%H7075><s%>, which he had gathered <S%H7408><s%> in Paddan-aram <S%H6307><s%>, to go <S%H935><s%> to Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%>.

Now Laban <S%H3837><s%> was gone <S%H1980><s%> to shear <S%H1494><s%> his sheep <S%H6629><s%>: and Rachel <S%H7354><s%> stole <S%H1589><s%> the teraphim <S%H8655><s%> that were her father <S%H1><s%>'s.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> stole away <S%H1589><s%> unawares <S%H3820><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%> the Syrian <S%H761><s%>, in that <S%H5921><s%> he told <S%H5046><s%> him not <S%H1097><s%> that he fled <S%H1272><s%>.

So he fled <S%H1272><s%> with all that he had <S%H6965><s%>; and he rose up, and passed over <S%H5674><s%> the River <S%H5104><s%>, and set <S%H7760><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> toward the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.
And it was told <S%H5046><s%> Laban <S%H3837><s%> on the third <S%H7992><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was fled <S%H1272><s%>.

And he took <S%H3947><s%> his brethren <S%H251><s%> with him <S%H7291><s%>, and pursued after him <S%H310><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>' journey <S%H1870><s%>; and he overtook <S%H1692><s%> him in the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%> the Syrian <S%H761><s%> in a dream <S%H2472><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H8104><s%>, Take heed to thyself that thou speak <S%H1696><s%> not to <S%H5973><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> bad <S%H7451><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> came <S%H5381><s%> up with Jacob <S%H3290><s%>. Now Jacob <S%H3290><s%> had pitched <S%H8628><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> in the mountain <S%H2022><s%>: and Laban <S%H3837><s%> with his brethren <S%H251><s%> encamped <S%H8628><s%> in the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, What hast thou done <S%H6213><s%>, that thou hast stolen away <S%H1589><s%> unawares <S%H3824><s%> to me <S%H5090><s%>, and carried away my daughters <S%H1323><s%> as captives <S%H7617><s%> of the sword <S%H2719><s%>?

Wherefore didst thou flee <S%H1272><s%> secretly <S%H2244><s%>, and steal away <S%H1589><s%> from me <S%H5046><s%>, and didst not tell me <S%H7971><s%>, that I might have sent thee away with mirth <S%H8057><s%> and with songs <S%H7892><s%>, with tabret <S%H8596><s%> and with harp <S%H3658><s%>;
and didst not suffer <S%H5203><s%> me to kiss <S%H5401><s%> my sons <S%H1121><s%> and my daughters <S%H1323><s%>? now hast thou done <S%H6213><s%> foolishly <S%H5528><s%>.

It is <S%H3426><s%> in the power <S%H410><s%> of my hand <S%H3027><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> you hurt <S%H7451><s%>: but the God <S%H430><s%> of your father <S%H1><s%> spake <S%H559><s%> unto me yesternight <S%H570><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Take heed <S%H8104><s%> to thyself that thou speak not <S%H1696><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or bad <S%H7451><s%>.

And now <S%H1980><s%>, though thou wouldest needs be gone <S%H1980><s%>, because thou sore <S%H3700><s%> longedst <S%H3700><s%> after thy father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, yet wherefore hast thou stolen <S%H1589><s%> my gods <S%H430><s%>?

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%>, Because I was afraid <S%H3372><s%>: for I said <S%H559><s%>, Lest <S%H6435><s%> thou shouldest take thy daughters <S%H1323><s%> from me by force <S%H1497><s%>.

With whomsoever <S%H834><s%> thou findest <S%H4672><s%> thy gods <S%H430><s%>, he shall not live <S%H2421><s%>: before <S%H5048><s%> our brethren <S%H251><s%> discern <S%H5234><s%> thou what is thine with me <S%H3947><s%>, and take it to thee <S%H3290><s%>. For Jacob knew <S%H3045><s%> not that Rachel <S%H7354><s%> had stolen them <S%H1589><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> went <S%H935><s%> into Jacob <S%H3290><s%>'s tent <S%H168><s%>, and into Leah <S%H3812><s%>'s tent <S%H168><s%>, and into the tent <S%H168><s%> of the two <S%H8147><s%> maid-servants <S%H519><s%>; but he found <S%H4672><s%> them not <S%H3318><s%>. And he went out of Leah <S%H3812><s%>'s tent <S%H168><s%>, and entered <S%H935><s%> into Rachel <S%H7354><s%>'s tent <S%H168><s%>.

Now Rachel <S%H7354><s%> had taken <S%H3947><s%> the teraphim <S%H8655><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> them in the camel <S%H1581><s%>'s saddle <S%H3733><s%>, and sat <S%H3427><s%> upon them <S%H3837><s%>. And Laban felt <S%H4959><s%> about all the tent <S%H168><s%>, but found them not <S%H4672><s%>.

And she said <S%H559><s%> to her father <S%H1><s%>, Let not my lord <S%H113><s%> be angry <S%H2734><s%> that I cannot <S%H3201><s%> rise up <S%H6965><s%> before thee <S%H6440><s%>; for the manner <S%H1870><s%> of women <S%H802><s%> is upon me <S%H2664><s%>. And he searched, but found <S%H4672><s%> not the teraphim <S%H8655><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was wroth <S%H2734><s%>, and chode <S%H7378><s%> with Laban <S%H3837><s%>: and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%>, What is my trespass <S%H6588><s%>? what is my sin <S%H2403><s%>, that thou hast hotly pursued <S%H1814><s%> after me <S%H310><s%>?

Whereas <S%H3588><s%> thou hast felt <S%H4959><s%> about all my stuff <S%H3627><s%>, what hast thou found <S%H4672><s%> of all thy household <S%H1004><s%> stuff <S%H3627><s%>? Set <S%H7760><s%> it here <S%H3541><s%> before my brethren <S%H251><s%> and thy brethren <S%H251><s%>, that they may judge <S%H3198><s%> betwixt <S%H996><s%> us two <S%H8147><s%>.

These twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> have I been with thee <S%H7353><s%>; thy ewes and thy she-goats <S%H5795><s%> have not cast their young <S%H7921><s%>, and the rams <S%H352><s%> of thy flocks <S%H6629><s%> have I not eaten <S%H398><s%>.

That which was torn <S%H2966><s%> of beasts I brought <S%H935><s%> not unto thee <S%H2398><s%>; I bare the loss of it <S%H3027><s%>; of my hand didst thou require <S%H1245><s%> it <S%H1589><s%>, whether stolen by day <S%H3117><s%> or stolen <S%H1589><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>.

Thus I was <S%H3117><s%>; in the day the drought <S%H2721><s%> consumed <S%H398><s%> me <S%H7140><s%>, and the frost by night <S%H3915><s%>; and my sleep <S%H8142><s%> fled <S%H5074><s%> from mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

These twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> have I been in thy house <S%H1004><s%>; I served thee <S%H5647><s%> fourteen <S%H702><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> for thy two <S%H8147><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> for thy flock <S%H6629><s%>: and thou hast changed <S%H2498><s%> my wages <S%H4909><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> times <S%H4489><s%>.

Except <S%H3884><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and the Fear <S%H6343><s%> of Isaac <S%H3327><s%>, had been with me <S%H7971><s%>, surely now hadst thou sent me away empty <S%H7387><s%>. God <S%H430><s%> hath seen <S%H7200><s%> mine affliction <S%H6040><s%> and the labor <S%H3018><s%> of my hands <S%H3709><s%>, and rebuked <S%H3198><s%> thee yesternight <S%H570><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> unto Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, The daughters <S%H1323><s%> are my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and the children <S%H1121><s%> are my children <S%H1121><s%>, and the flocks <S%H6629><s%> are my flocks <S%H6629><s%>, and all that thou seest <S%H7200><s%> is mine <S%H6213><s%>: and what can I do this day <S%H3117><s%> unto these my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, or <S%H176><s%> unto their children <S%H1121><s%> whom they have borne <S%H3205><s%>?
And now come <S%H3212><s%>, let us make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%>, I and thou <S%H5707><s%>; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%>, and set it up <S%H7311><s%> for a pillar <S%H4676><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto his brethren <S%H251><s%>, Gather <S%H3950><s%> stones <S%H68><s%>; and they took <S%H3947><s%> stones <S%H68><s%>, and made <S%H6213><s%> a heap <S%H1530><s%>: and they did eat <S%H398><s%> there by the heap <S%H1530><s%>.
And Laban <S%H3837><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> it Jegar-saha <S%H3026><s%>-dutha: but Jacob <S%H3290><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> it Galeed <S%H1567><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, This heap <S%H1530><s%> is witness <S%H5707><s%> between me and thee this day <S%H3117><s%>. Therefore was the name <S%H8034><s%> of it called <S%H7121><s%> Galeed <S%H1567><s%>:

and Mizpah <S%H4709><s%>, for <S%H834><s%> he said <S%H559><s%>, Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> watch <S%H6822><s%> between me and thee <S%H5641><s%>, when we are absent one <S%H376><s%> from another <S%H7453><s%>.

If thou shalt afflict <S%H6031><s%> my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and if thou shalt take <S%H3947><s%> wives <S%H802><s%> besides <S%H5921><s%> my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, no man <S%H376><s%> is with us <S%H7200><s%>; see, God <S%H430><s%> is witness betwixt me and thee <S%H5707><s%>.
And Laban <S%H3837><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, Behold this heap <S%H1530><s%>, and behold the pillar <S%H4676><s%>, which I have set betwixt me and thee <S%H3384><s%>.

This heap <S%H1530><s%> be witness <S%H5707><s%>, and the pillar <S%H4676><s%> be witness <S%H5713><s%>, that I will not pass over <S%H5674><s%> this heap <S%H1530><s%> to thee <S%H5674><s%>, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap <S%H1530><s%> and this pillar <S%H4676><s%> unto me <S%H7451><s%>, for harm.

The God <S%H430><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and the God <S%H430><s%> of Nahor <S%H5152><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of their father <S%H1><s%>, judge <S%H8199><s%> betwixt us <S%H3290><s%>. And Jacob sware <S%H7650><s%> by the Fear <S%H6343><s%> of his father <S%H1><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> offered <S%H2076><s%> a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> in the mountain <S%H2022><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> his brethren <S%H251><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>: and they did eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>, and tarried all night <S%H3885><s%> in the mountain <S%H2022><s%>.

And early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> Laban <S%H3837><s%> rose up <S%H7925><s%>, and kissed <S%H5401><s%> his sons <S%H1121><s%> and his daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and blessed <S%H1288><s%> them <S%H3837><s%>: and Laban departed <S%H3212><s%>, and returned <S%H7725><s%> unto his place <S%H4725><s%>.
